comments.creator: kdevel@vogtner.de
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110509 Firefox/6.0a1

After the loading has been stopped there is no right mouse menu available.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open url
2. press ESC or click "stop loading" button after 2 seconds of loading
3. right click into "rendered" content

Actual Results:  
no menu

Expected Results:  
menu

comments.raw_text:
wfm with Seamonkey trunk and FF4.0.1 on win32.
You already tried it without extensions (safemode) and did you try to change the replace context menu option in tools/options/content/javascript ?
comments.text:

> You already tried it without extensions (safemode) and 

Yes.

> did you try to change the replace context menu option in 
> tools/options/content/javascript ?

No menu regardless of the setting of "Disable or replace context menu".

comments.author: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.text:
This is somewhat related to the HTML5 parser. If you set html5.parser.enable to false the menu reappears.

The menu disappeared completely in HTML5 mode in this regression range:

Last good nightly: 2010-08-27 First bad nightly: 2010-08-28

Pushlog: http://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/pushloghtml?fromchange=e1d55bbd1d1d&tochange=6e3f6d18c124


But I don't know if I really would call the menu "good" before that regression since previously the right click menu was a bit hairy - with a huge number of entries.
comments.raw_text:

comments.author: hsivonen@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text: So you don't see the context menu if you stop the page load while the content area is blank, right? Before the paragraphs appear, that is.
comments.text: So you don't see the context menu if you stop the page load while the content area is blank, right? Before the paragraphs appear, that is.
